architectural_decisions.title: Use of Microservices Architecture
architectural_decisions.rationale: To ensure scalability, maintainability, and security in managing order-related operations.

architectural_decisions.title: Implementation of Repository Pattern
architectural_decisions.rationale: To abstract the data access layer and provide methods for CRUD operations, simplifying data manipulation and promoting code reusability.

architectural_decisions.title: Dependency Injection using FastAPI
architectural_decisions.rationale: To manage dependencies efficiently and promote testability, making the application easier to maintain and scale.

architectural_decisions.title: Custom Error Handling with FastAPI's HTTPException
architectural_decisions.rationale: To handle various error scenarios gracefully and provide meaningful responses to clients, improving overall system reliability.

architectural_decisions.title: Support for Multiple Payment Providers
architectural_decisions.rationale: To cater to diverse user preferences and facilitate seamless transactions across different platforms.

architectural_decisions.title: JWT Token-based Authentication
architectural_decisions.rationale: To ensure secure access control and authorization, safeguarding sensitive user information and resources.

architectural_decisions.title: ORM Usage for Database Interactions
architectural_decisions.rationale: To simplify database operations and improve code readability, making maintenance and development more efficient.

architectural_decisions.title: Sending Confirmation Emails on Order Creation
architectural_decisions.rationale: To enhance user experience by notifying them promptly about order confirmations, fostering trust and satisfaction.

Create and Manage Orders.description: REST API endpoints for creating, managing, and retrieving orders in the e-commerce application.

steps.description: Create a new order by sending a POST request to /api/orders/create with order items, shipping address, and payment method.
Retrieve order details using a GET request to /api/orders/{order_id}, where {order_id} is the unique identifier of the order.
List all orders for the current user by sending a GET request to /api/orders/, which supports pagination via limit and offset query parameters.
Cancel a pending order using a POST request to /api/orders/{order_id}/cancel, where {order_id} is the unique identifier of the order.
